page.text: United Nations
This record contains the original text of speeches delivered in English and interpretations of speeches
delivered in the other languages. Corrections should be submitted to original speeches only. They
should be incorporated in a copy of the record and be sent under the signature of a member of the
delegation concerned, within one month of the date of the meeting, to the Chief of the Verbatim
Reporting Service, Room C-178.
Corrections will be issued after the end of the session in a
consolidated corrigendum.
Fiftieth session
th plenary meeting
Thursday, 11 April 1996, 10 a.m.
New York
President:
Mr. Diogo Freitas do Amaral . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . (Portugal)

text.i: In the absence of the President, Mr. Moubarak
The meeting was called to order at 10.35 a.m.

text.b: Scale of assessments for the apportionment of the
expenses of the United Nations (Article 19 of the

page.text: The Acting President: I should like to inform
members that Guatemala has made the necessary payment
to reduce its arrears below the amount in Article 19 of the
Charter.
May I take it that the General Assembly duly takes
note of this information?
The Acting President: This information will be
reflected in an addendum to document A/50/888.
The Acting President: This morning the General
Assembly will consider the reports of the Fifth Committee
on agenda items 114, 116, 120, 128 and 167 and 168 and
I request the Rapporteur of the Fifth Committee, Mr.
Peter Maddens of Belgium, to introduce the reports of the
Fifth Committee in one intervention.
Mr. Maddens (Belgium), Rapporteur of the Fifth
Committee (interpretation from French): I have the
honour to introduce to the General Assembly the reports
of the Fifth Committee on the agenda items for today's
meeting.
All the negotiations on the various issues on the
Committee's agenda took place in informal meetings
chaired
by
members
of
the
Bureau
and
other
representatives to the Fifth Committee, in keeping with
the Committee's usual practice.
Action on all the draft resolutions adopted and
decisions taken during the first part of the resumed fiftieth
session of the General Assembly was by consensus. The
following is a brief report on the work of the Fifth
Committee.
The report of the Fifth Committee on agenda item
entitled
"Review
of
the
efficiency
of
the
administrative and financial functioning of the United
Nations", is contained in document A/50/840/Add.1. In
paragraph 6 of that report, the Fifth Committee
recommends to the General Assembly the adoption of
draft decision A/C.5/50/L.39, concerning the report of the
Secretary-General on the progress achieved in the
implementation of procurement reform in the Secretariat.
The draft decision was adopted by the Committee without
a vote.
General Assembly
104th plenary meeting
Fiftieth session
11 April 1996
The report of the Fifth Committee on agenda item
116, entitled "Proposed programme budget for the biennium
1996-1997", is contained in document A/50/842/Add.2. In
paragraph
of
that
report,
the Fifth
Committee
recommends to the General Assembly the adoption of a
draft decision, proposed orally by the Chairman of the
Committee, concerning unforeseen and extraordinary
expenses, in which it is recommended that the General
Assembly defer consideration of the question to the second
part of its resumed fiftieth session, in May 1996.
The report of the Fifth Committee on agenda item
120, entitled "Scale of assessments for the apportionment
of the expenses of the United Nations", is contained in
document A/50/843/Add.1. In paragraph 6 of that report,
the Fifth Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of draft resolution A/C.5/50/L.38. The draft
resolution was adopted by the Committee without a vote.
The report of the Fifth Committee on agenda item
136, entitled "Financing of the International Criminal
Tribunal for the Prosecution of Persons Responsible for
Serious Violations of International Humanitarian Law
Committed in the Territory of the Former Yugoslavia since
1991", is contained in document A/50/849/Add.1. In
paragraph
of
that
report,
the
Fifth
Committee
recommends to the General Assembly the adoption of draft
resolution A/C.5/50/L.35. The draft resolution was adopted
by the Committee without a vote.
The report of the Fifth Committee on agenda item
160, entitled "Financing of the International Criminal
Tribunal for the Prosecution of Persons Responsible for
Genocide and Other Serious Violations of International
Humanitarian Law Committed in the Territory of Rwanda
and Rwandan Citizens Responsible for Genocide and Other
Such
Violations
Committed
in
the
Territory
of
Neighbouring States between 1 January and 31 December
1994", is contained in document A/50/852/Add.1. In
paragraph
of
that
report,
the
Fifth
Committee
recommends to the General Assembly the adoption of draft
resolution A/C.5/50/L.36. The draft resolution was adopted
by the Committee without a vote.
Under agenda item 138 (a), entitled "Administrative
and budgetary aspects of the financing of the United
Nations peace-keeping operations:
financing of United
Nations peace-keeping operations", the report of the Fifth
Committee concerning the support account is contained in
document A/50/850/Add.2. In paragraph 6 of that report,
the Fifth Committee recommends to the General Assembly
the adoption of draft resolution A/C.5/50/L.42. The draft
resolution was adopted by the Committee without a vote.
Under the same agenda item, the report of the Fifth
Committee concerning the matter of death and disability
benefits and the question of reform of the procedure for
determining
reimbursement
to
Member
States
for
contingent-owned equipment is contained in document
A/50/850/Add.3. In paragraph 8 of that report, the
Committee recommends to the General Assembly the
adoption of two draft resolutions, A/C.5/50/L.40 and
A/C.5/50/L.44. Those two draft resolutions were adopted
by the Committee without a vote.
The report of the Fifth Committee on agenda item
138 (b), entitled "Relocation of Ukraine to the group of
Member States set out in paragraph 3 (c) of General
Assembly resolution 43/232", is contained in document
A/50/851/Add.1. In paragraph 6 of that report, the
Committee recommends to the General Assembly the
adoption of draft resolution A/C.5/50/L.41. The draft
resolution was adopted by the Committee without a vote.
Finally, the Fifth Committee, for time-saving and
procedural reasons, considered jointly agenda item 128,
entitled "Financing of the United Nations Protection
Force, the United Nations Confidence Restoration
Operation in Croatia, the United Nations Preventive
Deployment Force and the United Nations Peace Forces
headquarters"; agenda item 167, entitled "Financing of the
United Nations Mission in Bosnia and Herzegovina";
agenda item 168, entitled "Financing of the United
Nations Transitional Administration for Eastern Slavonia,
Baranja and Western Sirmium"; and agenda item 169,
entitled "Financing of the United Nations Preventive
Deployment Force". The report of the Fifth Committee on
those
four
items
is
contained
in
document
A/50/796/Add.2. In paragraph 7 of that report, the
Committee recommends to the General Assembly the
adoption of draft decision A/C.5/50/L.37, which was
adopted by the Committee without a vote.
The Acting President: If there is no proposal under
rule 66 of the rules of procedure, I shall take it that the
General Assembly decides not to discuss the reports of
the Fifth Committee that are before it today.
The Acting President: Statements will therefore be
limited to explanations of vote.
The
positions
of
delegations
regarding
the
recommendations of the Fifth Committee have been made
General Assembly
104th plenary meeting
Fiftieth session
11 April 1996
clear in the Committee and are reflected in the relevant
official records. May I remind members that under
paragraph 7 of decision 34/401 the General Assembly
agreed that
"When the same draft resolution is considered in
a Main Committee and in plenary meeting, a
delegation should, as far as possible, explain its vote
only once, i.e., either in the Committee or in plenary
meeting unless that delegation's vote in plenary
meeting is different from its vote in the Committee".
May I also remind delegations that, also in accordance
with General Assembly decision 34/401, explanations of
vote are limited to 10 minutes and should be made by
delegations from their seats.
Before
we
begin
to
take
action
on
the
recommendations contained in the reports of the Fifth
Committee, I should like to advise representatives that we
are going to proceed to take decisions in the same manner
as was done in the Fifth Committee.

text.b: Review of the efficiency of the administrative and
financial functioning of the United Nations: report of

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft decision recommended by the Fifth
Committee in paragraph 6 of Part II of its report.
The draft decision, entitled "Implementation of
procurement reform in the United Nations Secretariat", was
adopted in the Fifth Committee without a vote. May I take
it that the General Assembly wishes to do the same?
The Acting President: We have thus concluded this
stage of our consideration of agenda item 114.
Agenda item 116 (continued)

text.b: Programme budget for the biennium 1996-1997: report

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft decision recommended by the Fifth
Committee in paragraph 13 of Part III of its report.
The
draft
decision,
entitled
"Unforeseen
and
extraordinary expenses", was adopted by the Fifth
Committee without a vote. May I take it that the
Assembly wishes to do the same?
The Acting President: We have thus concluded this
stage of our consideration of agenda item 116.
Agenda item 120 (continued)

text.b: Scale of assessments for the apportionment of the
expenses of the United Nations: report of the Fifth

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Fifth Committee in paragraph 6 of Part II of its report.
The draft resolution was adopted by the Fifth
Committee without a vote. May I take it that the
Assembly wishes to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution
The Acting President: We have thus concluded this
stage of our consideration of agenda item 120.
Agenda items 128 (continued), 167, 168 and 169

text.b: Financing of the United Nations Protection Force, the
United Nations Confidence Restoration Operation in
Croatia, the United Nations Preventive Deployment
headquarters; Financing of the United Nations Mission
in Bosnia and Herzegovina; Financing of the United
Slavonia, Baranja and Western Sirmium; Financing of
the United Nations Preventive Deployment Force:

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft decision recommended by the Fifth
Committee in paragraph 7 of Part III of its report.
The draft decision was adopted by the Fifth
Committee without a vote. May I take it that the
Assembly wishes to do the same?
General Assembly
104th plenary meeting
Fiftieth session
11 April 1996
The Acting President: We have thus concluded this
stage of our consideration of agenda items 128, 167, 168
and 169.
Agenda item 136 (continued)

text.b: Financing of the International Tribunal for the
Committed in the Territory of the Former Yugoslavia
since 1991: report of the Fifth Committee (Part II)

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the Fifth
Committee in paragraph 6 of Part II of its report.
The draft resolution was adopted by the Fifth
Committee without a vote. May I take it that the Assembly
wishes to do the same?
(resolution
The Acting President: The General Assembly has
thus concluded this stage of its consideration of agenda
item 136.
Agenda item 138 (continued)

text.b: Administrative and budgetary aspects of the financing
of the United Nations peace-keeping operations:
Financing of the United Nations peace-keeping
operations: reports of the Fifth Committee (Parts
(b) Relocation of Ukraine to the group of Member
States set out in paragraph 3 (c) of General
Assembly resolution 43/232: report of the Fifth

page.text: The Acting President: We turn first to Parts III and
IV of the report of the Fifth Committee on agenda item
138 (a), entitled "Financing of the United Nations peace-
keeping operations" (A/50/850/Add.2 and Add.3).
The Assembly will take a decision on the draft
resolution recommended by the Fifth Committee in
paragraph 6 of Part III of its report (A/50/850/Add.2). The
draft resolution, entitled "Support account for peace-
keeping operations", was adopted by the Fifth Committee
without a vote. May I take it that the Assembly wishes to
do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution
The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the two draft resolutions recommended by
the Fifth Committee in paragraph 8 of Part IV of its
report (A/50/850/Add.3).
Draft
resolution
I,
entitled
"Reform
of
the
procedures for determining reimbursement to Member
States for contingent-owned equipment", was adopted by
the Fifth Committee without a vote. May I take it that the
Assembly wishes to do the same?
Draft resolution I was adopted (resolution 50/222).
The Acting President: Draft resolution II, entitled
"Death and disability benefits", was adopted by the Fifth
Committee without a vote. May I take it that the
Assembly wishes to do the same?
Draft resolution II was adopted (resolution 50/223).
The Acting President: Next, the Assembly will
consider Part II of the report of the Fifth Committee on
agenda item 138 (b), entitled "Relocation of Ukraine to
the group of Member States set out in paragraph 3 (c) of
General Assembly resolution 43/232" (A/50/851/Add.1).
The Assembly will take a decision on the draft
resolution recommended by the Fifth Committee in
paragraph 6 of Part II of its report. The draft resolution
was adopted by the Fifth Committee without a vote. May
I take it that the General Assembly wishes to do the
same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution
The Acting President: We have thus concluded this
stage of our consideration of agenda items 138 (a) and

104th plenary meeting
Fiftieth session
11 April 1996

Prosecution of Persons Responsible for Genocide and
Other Serious Violations of International Humanitarian
Law Committed in the Territory of Rwanda and
Rwandan Citizens Responsible for Genocide and Other
31 December 1994: report of the Fifth Committee (Part

page.text: The Acting President: The Assembly will now take
a decision on the draft resolution recommended by the
Fifth Committee in paragraph 6 of Part II of its report.
The draft resolution was adopted by the Fifth Committee
without a vote. May I consider that the General Assembly
wishes to do the same?
The draft resolution was adopted (resolution
The Acting President: We have thus concluded this
stage of our consideration of agenda item 160.
